title: The M-Shaped Mind
author: Benjamin G Nechicattu
description: Why I Never Fit Into One Box ‚Äî A reflection on being multi-passionate, the M-shaped mind, and why that's not confusion but capacity.
content:
Some people grow up knowing exactly what they want to be.

I didn't.

I wanted to draw.
Then I wanted to create.
Then I wanted to code.
Then I wanted to start a business.
Then I wanted to write.

And strangely‚Ä¶ I still want all of it.

For a long time, I thought something was wrong with me.

*Why can't I just pick one thing?*
*Why do I get deeply obsessed with something, master it halfway, then jump to another world?*

Then I discovered something that felt like someone had quietly written my biography.

---

## **The M-Shaped Mind**

There's a concept called **Multipotentialite**, popularized by Emilie Wapnick.

It describes people who don't have just one peak of expertise ‚Äî
they have multiple.

Not scattered.
Not confused.
Just‚Ä¶ multi-passionate.

Instead of being:

- **I-shaped** ‚Üí One deep skill
- **T-shaped** ‚Üí One deep skill + broad knowledge
- **M-shaped** ‚Üí Multiple deep skills

And suddenly, everything made sense.

---

## **My M**

If you look at my life from the outside, it looks random.

üé® I draw with pencil, charcoal, acrylic.
üõ† I make handmade things.
üíª I build systems using FastAPI and local LLMs.
üìà I explore business ideas like dropshipping and "Fluff & Fold."
‚úçÔ∏è I write.

But what if none of this is random?

What if the art feeds the storytelling.
The storytelling feeds the business.
The business feeds the tech.
The tech sharpens the creativity.

Maybe it's not distraction.
Maybe it's design.

---

## **The Problem With a Single-Lane World**

The world loves specialists.

*"Pick one thing."*
*"Focus."*
*"Don't get distracted."*

But what if your strength isn't narrowing ‚Äî
it's connecting?

An M-shaped mind doesn't just collect skills.
It builds bridges between them.

And sometimes the magic isn't in the depth of one field ‚Äî
it's in the collision between many.

---

## **The Hidden Struggle**

Let me be honest.

Having an M-shaped mind can feel exhausting.

You question yourself. You compare yourself to specialists. You wonder if you're just inconsistent.

But over time, I'm learning something:

I don't need to shrink my interests to fit a simple identity.
I need to build a life that can hold all of them.

---

## **Maybe This Is My Advantage**

Maybe I'm not meant to be:

Just an artist.
Just a coder.
Just a businessman.
Just a writer.

Maybe I'm meant to be all of it.

And maybe that's the point.

If you've ever felt like you don't fit into one label ‚Äî
maybe you don't have a scattered mind.
Maybe you have an M-shaped one.

And maybe that's not confusion.
Maybe that's **capacity**.
